articles.content:

articles.title: Gerrit Cole's longest no-hit bid of MLB career broken up in 8th inning as New York Yankees beat Tampa Bay Rays for 50th win
articles.description: Gerrit Cole took a no-hitter into the eighth inning -- the longest no-hit bid of his MLB career -- and the Yankees beat the Rays 4-2 on Monday night to put them 33 games over .500 at 50-17.
articles.content: TAMPA -- Gerrit Cole will continue topping the list of best active major league pitchers without a no-hitter after a spectacular seven-inning performance in the New York Yankees' 4-2 win over the Tam… [+3404 chars]

articles.title: Auburn Tigers, battling stomach bug, rally to eliminate No. 2 Stanford Cardinal at Men's College World Series
articles.description: With a stomach bug and nearly seven decades of history working against it, Auburn rallied for a 6-2 win over No. 2 seed Stanford, sending the Cardinal home from Omaha without a victory for the first time in 18 Men's College World Series appearances.

articles.title: 'We're back': Golden State Warriors revel in 4th title amid raucous parade
articles.description: The Warriors celebrated their fourth title in eight years in style as thousands crowded the streets of San Francisco for Monday's parade.
articles.content:
SAN FRANCISCO -- It's been two years since the Bay Area hosted a championship parade, but the city, nor the Warriors, forgot how to take in the moment.

articles.description: Rueben Owens II, the No. 2 running back in the 2023 ESPN 300, committed to Louisville on Monday, giving Scott Satterfield one of the biggest recruiting wins of his Cardinals coaching tenure.
articles.content:

articles.title: Wife of WNBA star Brittney Griner says scheduled call never happened because embassy was unstaffed
articles.description: Cherelle Griner said Brittney tried to call her wife nearly a dozen times through the American embassy in Russia for the couple's anniversary but the call never went through because the embassy was not staffed on Saturday.

articles.title: Houston Baptist men's basketball star Darius Lee killed, 8 others shot at Harlem gathering
articles.description: Darius Lee, a 21-year-old senior who starred for Houston Baptist, was killed at a gathering in Harlem. An All-Southland Conference pick, Lee led the Huskies in scoring and rebounding and was sixth in the nation in steals per game.
